lines.gurmukhi: jYsy Pl qy ibrK ibrK qy hoq Pl; AdBuq giq kCu khq n AwvY jI [

Shamsher Singh Puri.translation: Just as a tree is born out of fruit and fruit grows on the tree this act is wonderous and cannot be explained.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijvyˆ Pl qoˆ ibRC qy ibRC qoˆ Pl huMdw hY, Ascrj lIlHw kuC kihx ivc nhIˆ AwauˆdI[

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy bws bwvn mY bwvn hY bws ibKY; ibsm cirqR koaU mrm n pwvY jI [

Shamsher Singh Puri.translation: Just as fragrance is in sandalwood and sandalwood is in fragrance, no one can know secret of this astonishing display.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijvyˆ bwvncMdn ivc vwSnw hY AQvw vwSnw ivc cMdn hY, AnoKw cirqR hY koeI Byd nhIˆ pw skdw[

lines.gurmukhi: kws mY Agin Ar Agin mY kws jYsy; Aiq AscrX mX kOqk khwvY jI [

Shamsher Singh Puri.translation: Just as fire exists in wood and wood is fire. This play is no less amazing.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijvyˆ l`kV ivc A`g qy A`g ivc l`kV hY, ieh Aiq Ascrj rUp kOqk khwˆvdw hY[

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur mih sbd sbd mih siqgur hY; ingun sgun gÎwn DÎwn smJwvY jI [608[

Shamsher Singh Puri.translation: Similarly, the True Guru has word (Naam) and True Guru resides in it. The True Guru alone explains us the focusing of mind on the absolute and transcendental form of divine knowledge.  (608)

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: iesy qrHwˆ siqgurU ivc Sbd hY qy Sbd ivc siqgurU hY, inrgux ivc srgux hY qy srgux ivc inrgux hY, igAwˆn ivc iDAwn hY qy iDAwn ivc igAwn hY, ienHwˆ g`lwˆ dI smJ BI AYauˆ Aw jwˆdI hY ]608]
